STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 20, 2020
Matthew Yohe
Baraga/Houghton/Keweenaw County DHHS
P. O. Box 10
Baraga, MI 49908
RE: License #: CP070200958
Baraga/Houghton/Keweenaw County DHHS
108 Main Street
Baraga, MI 49908
Dear Mr. Yohe:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed
on 07/15/2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the Modified Implementation Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Courtney Atkins, Area Manager at (517) 599-3667.
.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5326
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child in a
foster home, then both of the following shall be documented
before a change in placement:
(a) A summary of the services provided during care up to the
time of the change in placement and the needs that remain to
be met.
One of 2 discharged foster care services files reviewed did not have a summary of
services provided and the needs that remain to be met documented in MiSACWIS
(Michigan Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System).
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child in a
foster home, then both of the following shall be documented
before a change in placement:
(b) Provision for any continuing services.
One of 2 discharged foster care services files reviewed did not have documentation
of provision for any continuing services.
4

SRM 200 Fingerprints
All personnel, contractors, vendors, and external auditors who
have access to CW-CHRI are required to complete Security
Awareness Training (SAT). Training is available on the Learning
Management System (LMS) for MDHHS personnel and contractors
with access to LMS. Non-contracted agencies will complete Finger
Print Security Awareness Training via the MDHHS public licensing
website.
SAT is required to be taken within six months of working in a
position with CW-CHRI access and every two years thereafter.
CPAs are responsible for ensuring that all personnel with CHRI
access completes SAT timely. DCWL field consultants will monitor
completion of SAT for all CPAs as part of the annual licensing
inspection.
One or 5 employees who have access to CW-CHRI did not have updated Security
Awareness Training (SAT) training as required by the policy.
This is a repeat violation.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
There were no additional MISEP violations.
3.) Please note that there are additional DHHS Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Policy
requirements except for the following:
There were no additional Policy violations.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was not in need of additional consultation.
5

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan which was approved on 08/20/2019.
The agency was cited for lack of face to face supervision of independent living,
documentation that the caseworker viewed the foster child’s bedroom and
documentation of unannounced visits with caretakers. The were no repeat violations
on the above items.
The agency was cited for Fingerprint training on the 2019 Interim Inspection and their
August 20, 2019 corrective action plan did not prevent them from being cited at this
Renewal Inspection. This is a repeat violation.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
07/20/2020
________________________________________
Don Collier Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
07/21/2020
________________________________________
Courtney Atkins Date
Area Manager
